attributes.action: Implement urgently, a reduction from PM10 Air QualityMonitoring nationally, to PM2.5 and below as the standard reference baseline in Planning decisions
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The current monitoring levels of air quality, fail to recognise that the particulates of PM2.5 and below, are the most dangerous of the particulates floating around in the air.
Opencast Mining causes levels of PM2.5 and below to be raised, thus causing health disorders such as asthma,respiritory disease, and cardio -vascular illness and mortality.
DEFRA report june 2005,"Particulate Matter In The United KingdomIf PM10 particulate monitorint remains as the accepted level of air quality for the UK, what happened to the Human Rights act, articles8(1)-The right to protection against aircraft noise and pollution and includes a duty to inform the public about enviromental hazards. Article2 states that public authorities have a positive obligation to protect the right to life if it is established that they failed to take measures within the scope of their powers which, judged reasonably, might have been expected to avoid this risk. This could be applied to local authorities and the granting of planning permission.
